description.narrative: The VPFCBP is a five year project which commenced in February 2006. It was established at the request of the Government of Vanuatu to support the capacity development of the Vanuatu Police Force (VPF). The program presents a significant long-term commitment to the Government of Vanuatu to assist in the development of efficient, independent and accountable policing services. Integral to the success of the VPFCBP is ensuring the ongoing partnership with the VPF. The VPFCBP is a whole-of-government effort between two Commonwealth of Australia agencies, AusAID and the Australian Federal Police (AFP), and the VPF on behalf of the Government of Vanuatu. It is unique in Vanuatu in that is an AusAID managed and funded project, drawing on the technical expertise of the AFP. The VPFCBP is being implemented in accordance with the 2005 Project Design Document (PDD) and subsequent 2006 Project Implementation Document (PID).
